Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that looks healthy because it has enough water and light.
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy because it does not have enough water.
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy because it does not have enough light.
The student can illustrate the differences between plants with and without water and light by showing specific changes, such as wilting or color changes.
The student can identify patterns by showing, through pictures, how plants need water and light to live and grow.
